text.*:
The examples and perspective in this article deal primarily with the English-speaking world and do not represent a worldwide view of the subject. You may improve this article, discuss the issue on the talk page, or create a new article, as appropriate. (February 2018) (Learn how and when to remove this template message)
This is a dynamic list and may never be able to satisfy particular standards for completeness. You can help by expanding it with reliably sourced entries.

This is a list of the oldest cats in the world, listed by reported age, all of whom have attained the minimum age of 20. Aging in cats depends on breed, size and diet.

Some of the ages reported here are approximate. Others are based on estimates or hearsay. Few of them have been confirmed by any authoritative agency.

Contents

  • 1 Oldest cats by reported age
  • 2 See also
  • 3 References
  • 4 External links

Oldest cats by reported age[edit]

Rank Name Birth date Death date Reported age Breed Country Ref Notes
1 Creme Puff August 3, 1967 August 6, 2005 7004138830000000000♠38 years, 3 days Tabby mix United States [1][2][3] Same owner as Granpa Rexs Allen.
2 Baby 1970 March, 2008 38 years Black DSH United States [4][5]
3 Puss November 28, 1903 November 29, 1939 7004131500000000000♠36 years, 1 day Tabby United Kingdom [6]
4 Ma November 5, 1957 34 years, 5 months Tabby DSH United Kingdom [7][8]
5 Granpa Rexs Allen February 1, 1964 April 1, 1998 34 years, 2 months Sphynx-Devon Rex United States [9][10][11] Age reported as 26 in 1996 newspaper article, then as 33 at death in 1998; owner later claimed to have "miscalculated" age[12]
6 Sarah March 1982 September 2015 33 years, 6 months New Zealand [13][14]
7 Miez Maz 33 years Switzerland [15]
8 Nutmeg 1985 August 29, 2017 32 years Tabby United Kingdom [16][17]
9 Kitty June 1989 31 years, 11 months Black DSH United Kingdom [18] Oldest recorded feline mother; gave birth to a litter of 2 kittens at the age of 30.
10 Spike May 1970 July 2001 31 years, 2 months Tabby United Kingdom [19][20]
11 Sasha 1986 31 years United Kingdom [21]
12 Whiskey August 1, 1985 September 11, 2015 7004109980000000000♠30 years, 41 days United Kingdom [22]
13 Henry March 1986 30 years United Kingdom [23][24]
14 Scooter March 26, 1986 April 2016 30 years Siamese cat United States [25]
15 Missan 1985 29 years Sweden [26]
16 Squeak 1987 29 years Calico cat United States [27][28]
17 Cola November 1985 28 years Black cat United Kingdom [29]
18 Soot 1987 28 years Canada [30]
19 Tiffany Two March 13, 1988 May 22, 2015 27 years, 70 days Tortoiseshell cat United States [31][32]
20 Wadsworth March 6, 1986 27 years United Kingdom [33]
21 Banjo 1989 27 years United Kingdom [34] Reference indicates year of birth could be as late as 1991.
22 Kataleena Lady March 11, 1977 27 years Burmese cat Australia [35][36]
23 Tammy March 1990 26 years, 26 days United Kingdom [37]
24 Hobo 1986 26 years United States [38]
25 Corduroy August 1, 1989 26 years Tortoiseshell cat United States [39][40]
26 Tattie 1991 26 years Calico cat Canada [41]
27 Phoebe August 1989 24 years Ireland [42]
28 Olive March 1990 24 years United Kingdom [43]
29 Boss 1990 24 years United Kingdom [44]
30 Poppy February 1990 June 6, 2014 24 years Tortoiseshell cat United Kingdom [45]
31 Angel April 1992 March 28, 2016 23 years, 11 months United Kingdom [46]
32 Elfie 1991 23 years Germany [47] Lived in the United Kingdom until age 19.
33 Boo 1994 23 years Maine Coon New Zealand [48]
34 Rusty 1994 23 years United Kingdom [49]
35 Pinky October 31, 1989 2013 22 years United States [50]
36 Kitty July 1884 22 years United States [51]
37 Cleo March 1993 21 years United Kingdom [52]
38 Buster Brown 1900 1921 21 years United States [53]
39 Fuzz 1896 1917 21 years United States [54]
40 Hortense 1996 21 years Scottish Fold Canada [55]

References[edit]

  1. ^ Guinness World Records 2010. Bantam; Reprint edition. 2010. p. 320. ISBN 978-0-553-59337-2. The oldest cat ever was Creme Puff, who was born on August 3, 1967 and lived until August 6, 2005–38 years and 3 days in total. 
  2. ^ Oldest cat ever, Guinness World Records Corporate, retrieved 20 April 2012 
  3. ^ Warren, Jessica (Oct 23, 2009). "Caterack Dies – World's Oldest Cat Was 30!". The National Ledger. Archived from the original on 9 May 2012. Retrieved 18 January 2018. A report from MSNBC News notes that the oldest cat ever recorded was a 38-year-old feline named Creme Puff, according to a rep from Guinness World Records. 
  4. ^ "37-Year Old Cat Still Going Strong". Farm Show. 31 (5): 24. 2007. Baby won the oldest cat entry in a recent contest held by Cat Fancy magazine. Palusky's main evidence of Baby's age is a photo of him when he was 3; the photo is dated 1973 
  5. ^ "The Feline Fountain of Youth". Cat Fancy. 51 (8): 10. 2008. 
  6. ^ McWhirter, Norris (1990). Guinness 1990 Book of World Records. Bantam Books. p. 65. ISBN 0553284525. The oldest cat ever recorded was probably the tabby "Puss," owned by Mrs T. Holway of Clayhidon, Devon, England, who celebrated his 36th birthday on Nov 28, 1939 and died the next day 
  7. ^ McWhirter, Norris (1990). Guinness 1990 Book of World Records. Bantam Books. p. 65. ISBN 0553284525. 
  8. ^ Wood, Gerald. Guinness Book of Pet Records. Sterling. p. 78. ISBN 0851122957. The greatest reliable age recorded for a cat is 34 years 5 months for a female tabby named 'Ma' owned by Mrs Alice St George Moore 
  9. ^ Maggitti, Phil (April–May 2009). "Owners/History: Granpa Rexs Allen". Sphynx Breeders / Enthusiast Newsletter. Archived from the original on January 31, 2013. 
  10. ^ "Granpa Rexs Allen - 32 Year old Sphynx cat - 1999 Cat of the Year". CNN News. 1999. CNN. He's often mistaken for a Chihuahua but this is the nation's oldest known cat who has well outlived his nine lives. Meet Granpa Rexs Allen - part Rex, part Sphynx - celebrating his 32nd birthday. That's 32 in human years, 165 in cat years. 
  11. ^ Couch, Christina (December 15, 2015). "How to Raise a 165-Year-Old Cat". Atlas Obscura. 
  12. ^ Maggitti, Phil (April–May 2009). "Owners/History: Granpa Rexs Allen". Sphynx Breeders / Enthusiast Newsletter. Archived from the original on January 31, 2013. In noting his passing, the Austin American-Statesman began, “Grandpa Rexs Allen, possibly the oldest cat in the United States at 33, died Wednesday morning at his Austin home. His owner said the cause of death was pneumonia.” The article also mentioned that “Perry had hoped to get Grandpa into the Guinness Book of Records. The oldest cat in that book is an English feline that died at 34. Perry still thinks Grandpa may get into the book - he said he might have miscalculated the cat's age, and Grandpa may have been 34 already.” Eager to learn how Granpa, who had been a reported 26 and an estimated 31 in 1996, had gotten to be 33 just two years later, Cats & Kittens spoke with Jake Perry last spring. 
  13. ^ O'Callaghan, Jody (June 13, 2013). "Plucky Sarah may be NZ's oldest cat". Stuff.co.nz. 
  14. ^ O'Callaghan, Jody (September 9, 2015). "Kiwi cat vying for oldest moggy record dies". Stuff.co.nz. 
  15. ^ "One of world's oldest cats mistakenly put down by vet". February 14, 2012. 
  16. ^ Jeeves, Paul (January 28, 2016). "Meet the world's OLDEST cat: Nutmeg the grumpy tabby who is going strong at 31-years-old". Daily Express. 
  17. ^ World’s oldest cat dies at the age of 32 (that’s 144 in cat years), Metro, retrieved September 15, 2017
  18. ^ McWhirter, Norris (1995). The Guinness Book of Records 1996. Random House. p. 63. ISBN 0553542273. 
  19. ^ Allred, Alexandra Powe (2005). Cats' Most Wanted: The Top 10 Book of Mysterious Mousers, Talented Tabbies, and Feline Oddities. Potomac Books, Inc. p. 218. ISBN 1-57488-858-7. 
  20. ^ "World's oldest cat dies". BBC News. July 11, 2001. 
  21. ^ Deeney, Donna (July 21, 2017). "Northern Ireland cat Sasha could be world's oldest at 31". Belfast Telegraph. 
  22. ^ "Whiskey, 'world's oldest' cat, dies aged 30 in Buckinghamshire". The Daily Telegraph. September 14, 2015. 
  23. ^ Anderson, Stuart (May 30, 2016). "Could this Norwich cat be the oldest feline in the world?". Eastern Daily Press. 
  24. ^ Linning, Stephanie (May 30, 2016). "Is this the world's oldest cat? Owner insists ginger 30-year-old Henry should take title currently held by a moggy from Oregon". Daily Mail. 
  25. ^ "Oldest cat in the world, Scooter, dies aged 30". BBC. Retrieved 16 May 2016. 
  26. ^ "Meet the world's oldest cat, Missan, who turns 30 this year". WGN-TV. February 23, 2013. 
  27. ^ Smolka, Maggie (January 23, 2016). "Johnson City could be the home of the world's oldest cat". WCYB-TV. 
  28. ^ "World's oldest cat could live in Tennessee". WTHR. June 24, 2016. 
  29. ^ Grafton-Green, Patrick (August 28, 2013). "World's oldest cat is living in Orpington – and is same age as Dizzee Rascal". News Shopper. 
  30. ^ Brown, Audra (August 17, 2015). "Toronto feline claiming to be oldest cat in the world". CityNews. 
  31. ^ Thorne, Dan (6 February 2015). "Oldest cat living: Tiffany Two from California claims world record". GuinnessWorldRecords.com. Archived from the original on 1 April 2015. Retrieved 4 June 2015. 
  32. ^ "World's oldest living cat Tiffany two celebrates her 27th birthday". Mail Online. 
  33. ^ "Wadsworth, 27-Year-Old British Cat, May Be The World's Oldest". Huffington Post. March 14, 2013. 
  34. ^ Jamieson, Amy (September 27, 2016). "Twentysomething Shelter Kitty Dubbed 'Britain's Oldest Cat' Finds Forever Home". People. 
  35. ^ Whitlark, Kevin; Regan, Patrick (2005). The Red Cat Society: Keeping Life Frisky, Fun, and Fabulous!. Andrews McMeel Publishing. According to Guinness World Records, the oldest living cat is a Burmese called Kataleena Lady who lives in Melbourne, Australia. Kataleena Lady was born on March 11, 1977. Roll on, you saucy Aussie! 
  36. ^ Allred, Alexandra Powe (2011). Cats' Most Wanted: The Top 10 Book of Mysterious Mousers, Talented Tabbies, and Feline Oddities. Potomac Books. ISBN 1612342930. As of 2004 Guinness recognizes Kataleena Lady of Victoria, Australia, as the oldest living cat, born on March 1, 1977. 
  37. ^ Robinson, Martin (April 13, 2016). "Britain's oldest cat Tammy is 26 years and 26 days old… and just a whisker away from becoming the oldest moggy in the world". Daily Mail. 
  38. ^ Ray, Debbie (March 26, 2012). "Oldest Cat in Louisiana Celebrated 26th Birthday". KTDY. 
  39. ^ Swatman, Rachel (13 August 2015). "Spotlight: Corduroy is crowned the oldest living cat". Guinness World Records. Retrieved 14 August 2015. 
  40. ^ Hetter, Katia (13 August 2015). "Corduroy, 26, named oldest living cat". Cable News Network. Retrieved 14 August 2015. 
  41. ^ "Happy birthday dear Tattie!". www.reseausecoursanimal.org. 
  42. ^ Riegel, Ralph (April 4, 2014). "Moggy milestone... Phoebe (24) is world's oldest cat". Irish Independent. 
  43. ^ Hull, Liz (September 19, 2014). "Is Olive the world's oldest moggy by a whisker? Feline lays claim to title after turning 24... or 115 in cat years". Daily Mail. 
  44. ^ Sykes, Andy (June 26, 2014). "Could battler Boss be the world's oldest cat?". Blackpool Gazette. 
  45. ^ Donnelley, Paul (June 10, 2014). "Poppy, the world's oldest cat dies at 24 after falling ill weeks after being given the record". Daily Mail. 
  46. ^ Hughes, Lorna (April 3, 2016). "Was much-missed moggy Angel Merseyside's oldest cat?". Liverpool Echo. 
  47. ^ "Is this expat cat the world's oldest?". The Local. July 17, 2014. 
  48. ^ Hess, Allison (April 24, 2017). "What The Feline: 23-year-old cat defies expectations in Tauranga". Bay of Plenty Times. 
  49. ^ "Is 23-year-old Rusty the oldest cat in Derbyshire?". Derbyshire Times. March 15, 2017. 
  50. ^ Glenday, Craig, ed. (2013). Guinness World Records 2013. Bantam Books. p. 262. ISBN 0-345-54711-X. 
  51. ^ "Items of Interest". Our Paper. Concord Junction: Massachusetts Reformatory. 22 (24): 384. June 16, 1906. 
  52. ^ "Is this the UK's oldest cat?". The Sunday Post. February 16, 2014. 
  53. ^ Logan, Robert R., ed. (July 1921). "Buster Brown". The Starry Cross. Philadelphia: American Anti-Vivisection Society. 30 (7): 105. 
  54. ^ Campbell, D.M., ed. (May 1917). "untitled". American Journal of Veterinary Medicine. Chicago: American Veterinary Publishing. 12 (5): 346. 
  55. ^ "What's the secret to a long life? Quebec's oldest cat and dog offer up clues". CBC.ca. April 21, 2017.
